history.content:
No need to tag eecs as this is about the L&S CS major

This depends on if you fulfill one of L&S's reasons to be on a reduced courseload (parent, DSP, graduating student). 


As being a TA requires you be fully enrolled, I don't think you could claim the employment reason.

children.subject:
Thanks Sinho. 

How was your experience doing this?

And if I may ask, what were your appointments?

I was 12 hours for CS 70, 8 hours for EE 126.

I think the experience depends a lot on what your appointments actually are. I think it's likely that you'll spend more time with a split appointment than if you have a single appointment. If you TA for two courses, then you may hold one hour of OH for each course, which is the same as holding 2 hours of OH for a split appointment, so the weekly responsibilities might be similar. But you'll have to grade twice as many exams, attend twice as many meetings, hold twice as many review sessions, prepare for twice as much material, etc. The latter type of responsibilities scale up more than simply going from 8 to 20 hours for a single course. Just know what you're getting into.

I don't want to say too much about my personal experience, because I think that would say more about my specific appointments rather than the general idea of a split appointment.

Thank you for the response!

Just wondering, is it possible for someone to TA for two classes (e.g two 8 hr appointments or one 10 and one 8)?

history.content: Question: Is it possible to take 2 TA offers and then take a reduced course load as a L&S CS Major?
history.subject: Question About Reduced Load + TA

history.content: Question: Is it possible to take 2 TA offers and then take a reduced course load as a L&S CS Major?
